author: marchhill
content: Responded to your comments. Just want to verify that this statement is correct? "The IL is always encoded as an array of RLP encoded transactions in hex form."

author: marchhill
content: Also is there any reason to introduce a new payload status `INVALID_INCLUSION_LIST` rather than just returning `INVALID` and an error message? There are lots of other reasons why the payload could be invalid that don't have their own unique status

author: terencechain
content: New error code so CL can distinguish a specific error where the payload does not satisfy the inclusion list and attempt to reorg the block

author: jih2nn
content:
Yes that's true but I also feel like that's unnecessary to add. That holds when IL is an array of transactions but might not be the case when we modify IL in the future. We currently don't have any plan to modify it but I want to point out that the statement doesn't seem forward compatible.

I think introducing changes to engine API in the EIP and covering details including IL encoding elsewhere such as execution-apis is better abstraction.

author: marchhill
content: Ok makes sense, I’m curious though wouldn’t we do this in any case where the payload was invalid?

author: terencechain
content: if the payload was invalid then the block is invalid, in this case for IL, we dont want to make the block as invalid

author: marchhill
content: I have some thoughts on the IL building rules which I shared in the ethmagicians thread. What do you think <@845691100072509460>? https://ethereum-magicians.org/t/eip-7805-committee-based-fork-choice-enforced-inclusion-lists-focil/21578/6?u=marchhill

author: terencechain
content: https://hackmd.io/@ttsao/il-tx-scoring I didnt spent too much time on this but wrote down a few thoughts as well

author: marchhill
content: Interesting idea, imo adding some randomness is important though, even if we have some diversity between clients scoring function. I’m proposing to optimise for minimal overlap between ILs

author: soispoke
content:
one aspect that was quite important is to include the time spent in the mempool criteria (or randomness, this works too) so a proposer can't stuff the ILs with high priority fee txns (if everyone just uses the descending order of priority fee) 

why do you think minimal overlap between ILs is a good thing to optimize for?

author: marchhill
content: If we have complete overlap we only have 8kb of transactions that can fit in the IL. Even if there is space in the block the builder can censor any remaining txs in the pool. With no overlap that goes up to 128kb

author: bridge-bot
content: <soispoke> Yes but I think we do want « some » overlap as well imo so the one out of N property holds

author: marchhill
content: what exactly is the one out of N property? In the thread I suggest dividing up txs from the pool between committee members, but having some random jitter. This means you can’t reliably know which committee member will include each tx, there will be some small overlap
